p: To the authors’ knowledge, this is the first alternative treatment (alternative therapy) based on bioactive compounds with antibacterial activity against E. canis. Figure 1 shows the percentage of inhibition of E. canis infection in cells after 18 h and 36 h of treatment with the essential oil of A. conyzoides. It is noted that at the concentration of 200 µg/mL at 36 h this hydrophobic liquid inhibited a percentage greater than 50% of E. canis morulae formation. This result demonstrates the in vitro efficacy of this oil.
